alert.note: Alert for Northwest St. Tammany; Southern Tangipahoa; Washington (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 03 at 10:51AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern St. Tammany, east central Tangipahoa and Washington Parishes, southeastern Walthall and western Pearl River Counties through 1115 AM CST... At 1050 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Sandy Hook to near Covington. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Bogalusa, Picayune, Covington, Poplarville, Abita Springs, Varnado, Folsom, Sun, Enon, Crossroads, Robert, Bush, Mcneil and Angie. This includes Interstate 59 in Mississippi between mile markers 30 and 42. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Northwest St. Tammany; Southern Tangipahoa; Washington
